result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron D Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: STAYED.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.
STAYED.  Conditions, if revoked, are as those outlined in Conditions of Probation.

miscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Comply with all rules and regulations of supervising agent.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate, including cognitive intervention, and follow through with recommendations.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the defendant to be sure the defendant understands that he is aborting the motion that was to be heard this afternoon.

BTC: The Court finds the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives the motion. guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Aaron D Evans in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Aaron D Evans in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant Aaron D Evans in custody.  Noah Michael Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
